newsitem.headline: TABLE-Witco Corp Q2 oper net rises. [CORRECTED 13:55 GMT]

text.p: Three Months Ended Six Months Ended
(Corrects six months 1997 net income to 53,300 from (53,500).)

NOTES: (A) Depreciation expense for three months ended June 30, 1997 and 1996 and six months ended June 30, 1997 and 1996, respectively, was $21,817,000, $25,361,000, $44,642,000 and $50,678,000. Amortization expense for the periods was $6,180,000, $7,317,000, $12,246,000, and $14,728,000.

(B) The restructuring charge of $3,220,000 ($1,964,000 after-tax or $0.03 per common share) and $6,758,000 ($4,122,000 after-tax or $0.07 per common share) for the three and six month periods ended June 30, 1997 primarily relates to expenditures for equipment at sites previously identified for closure, which otherwise would have been capitalized.

(C) The six month periods ended June 30, 1997 and 1996 include gains of $950,000 ($580,000 after-tax or $0.01 per common share) and $2,936,000 ($1,791,000 after-tax or $0.03 per common share) as a result of settlements with certain of the company's insurers, net of related legal and other costs.

(D) The three and six month periods ended June 30, 1997 include an adjustment to the provision recorded in 1996 for the loss on disposal associated with the Lubricants Group. The adjustment for $9,990,000 (net of income taxes), or $0.17 per common share, is primarily the result of revised estimates from the sale of various Lubricants businesses. The three and six month periods ended June 30, 1996 include a provision for estimated loss on disposal (net of income tax benefit) of $68,253,000, or $1.20 per common share, associated with the divestiture of the Lubricants Group.
